Mike Banning.Action: Addresses the President’s son, Connor, with friendly concern and playful teasing.
Responds modestly to presidential praise, showing humility.
Exhibits watchful, protective behavior during snowmobile ride with dignitaries.
Skillfully leads the group on snowmobiles through snowy terrain, ensuring safety and demonstrating confidence in his role as a Secret Service agent.
Engages warmly and appropriately with the President’s young son, showing situational awareness and emotional intelligence alongside professional skill.
Deflects political question politely, showing humility and avoidance of conflict.
Leads group recreationally on snowmobiles, ensuring everyone is ready before starting.
Sprints across dangerous, cracking ice to reach Maggie’s Sno-Cat and urgently commands her to get off for her safety.
Immediately strips off his parka and dives into freezing water to rescue Maggie despite the extreme risk to himself.
Continues to dive repeatedly underwater despite himself running out of air, showing extraordinary determination to save Maggie.
Grabs Maggie’s arm and pulls her toward the surface, breaking the ice to rescue her from drowning.
Stares trembling in the cold as Maggie is unresponsive despite rescue efforts; lowers gaze when locking eyes with the President.
Draws his gun from the shoulder holster and shoots to break the ice, enabling him to burst out of the freezing water and rescue Maggie.
Stares trembling in the cold after Maggie is pulled from the water and unresponsive, showing emotional struggle.
Responds vaguely and awkwardly when invited for dinner, shows hesitation and distraction while on the phone.
Focuses intently on breaking news about a national crisis and the President's address before abruptly ending the call to go to work.
Handles minor practical issues (moves overflowing bucket, slides wastebasket) without urgency or care, body language suggests low energy or demotivation.
Dresses in a worn Secret Service uniform that looks unprofessional, and drives a beat-up pickup truck, suggesting some neglect in outward professionalism.
Greets water and sewer workmen in a friendly manner, initiating casual conversation.
Acknowledges the concerns of the workers about the old pipes and potential danger without dismissal.
Uses a master key to assist with the manhole cover issue, showing willingness to help practical problems.
Engages casually and knowledgeably with workmen about underground pipes and explosives, demonstrating awareness of infrastructure age and risks.
Produces a master key from his belt key chain in response to a problem, showing preparedness and resourcefulness.
Uses his master key to unlock the manhole cover after others failed, enabling progress.
Follows Ortiz into the unpleasant, stinky sewer tunnel without complaint or hesitation.
Conjures a master key from his belt key chain and successfully unlocks the manhole cover which others could not lift.
Follows Ortiz into the sewer tunnel despite the overpowering stench and difficult conditions, showing perseverance and willingness to engage in unpleasant tasks.
Shrugs noncommittally when asked why he’s in the sewer tunnel.
Responds quietly and dispassionately to Ortiz’s attempt at humor.
Fidgets restlessly while Ortiz works, shrugs noncommittally when questioned about why he is down in the sewers.
Follows Ortiz quickly up the manhole ladder without hesitation or delay.
Leaps from the open manhole, draws pistol, and fires repeatedly at the attacking plane despite overwhelming danger.
Gets to his feet quickly after a crash, ready to respond.
Watches helplessly as gunfire echoes, battling the urge to rush blindly into danger.
Works quickly and efficiently to reload weapon and proceed with caution in a dangerous environment.
Moves through dark, claustrophobic tunnels determinedly to confront a threat.
Navigates a claustrophobic, pitch-black pipe with determination and physical capability.
Identifies and quickly uses a master key to unlock a high-security electro-mechanical lock under pressure.
Enters the correct numeric code and uses proper authentication verbally, demonstrating knowledge of security protocols.
Tries to crawl forward despite darkness and obstacles, shows persistence.
Reacts with frustration briefly ('Shit --') but does not display hostility or rudeness toward others.
Quickly crawls forward into the stainless steel aqueduct despite unknown dangers.
Assesses his environment and recognizes the motion detector beams ahead, realizing there is no way past, expressing frustration.
Does not immediately attempt to disable or otherwise circumvent the motion detectors; momentarily stalled.
Remains composed as the dangerous avalanche of water rushes through the pipe toward him, preparing to hold his breath and face the torrent.

Hangs on against enormous pressure underwater, strains lungs, gasps for breath, but rapidly drags himself forward through the pipe hand over hand despite panic, notices and interprets motion detector beam position precisely, showing situational awareness and ability to remain focused under extreme duress.
Crawls forward through a pitch-black water main, demonstrating persistence and physical endurance under dangerous conditions.
Using a specially-designed bumper key to bypass a locked access door efficiently despite exhaustion and bruising.
Uses a specially-designed bumper key to skillfully bypass an electronic lock without triggering audit logs and successfully opens the access door.
Notices a video camera activating and quickly adapts by shrinking back and moving in the opposite direction to avoid detection.
Peers warily around corners, observes the situation cautiously without rushing into danger.
Retreats silently after observing suspicious military crates, demonstrating situational awareness and discretion.
Kneels beside fallen agent Roma, recognizes him and removes shuriken from his forehead.
Gently closes Roma’s staring eyes after confirming his death.
Leaps on commandos with lethal force, violently kills them in combat.
Quickly assesses situation in the Oval Office and attempts to contact help despite jammed lines.
Shows concern upon seeing Connor and tries to engage before danger appears.
Kills the commando swiftly to protect Connor and pursue him.
Kicks down locked door to pursue and protect.
Frantically tries to contact National Military Command Center to help the President.
Slumps against desk showing exhaustion and possible despair.
Kicks the locked door down quickly to pursue the target without hesitation.
Uses Asher’s BlackBerry to attempt communication with the National Military Command Center despite lines being jammed, showing resourcefulness and presence of mind.
Expresses confusion upon not finding Connor in the office, indicating a realistic and cautious mental state rather than rash assumptions.
Shows focused concern by immediately asking for the President’s location and the demands of the kidnappers.
Cuts off Trumbull's dismissive remark and insists on understanding the situation, demonstrating sincerity and determination.
Inquires knowledgeably about classified information (Cerberus), indicating trustworthiness and seriousness.
Challenges military authority figures who undermine him, reflecting confidence but potentially causing friction.
Insists on changing the Cerberus codes to prevent nuclear destruction, showing concern for safety.
Demands clarification and pushes for action despite resistance, demonstrating persistence but possibly impatience.
Immediately challenges the idea that codes can't be changed and asks where the computer controlling Cerberus is located.
Fails to quickly come up with a way to change the codes remotely despite understanding the problem.
Moves silently and swiftly to confront and eliminate threats without hesitation, showing high professionalism and focus.
Moves silently up the stairwell, spots two commandos simultaneously, and shoots them down with millisecond-fast reflexes.
Immediately reacts to surprise by taking down threats quickly and efficiently, showing tactical awareness and marksmanship.
Shares a solemn, respectful glance with the painting of George Washington before moving forward under fire.
Rescues himself under heavy gunfire, kills a commando to survive.
Uses molotov cocktails to fight off approaching enemies, protecting himself and slowing attackers.
Dives behind cover quickly when under heavy fire and reacts rapidly to changing combat conditions.
Successfully eliminates an enemy commando with a precise shot through the wall and immediately moves forward.
Uses environment creatively by grabbing a bottle of gin and lighting Molotov cocktails to create a fire barrier against chasing enemies.
Maintains situational awareness under stress, as shown by his quick decision-making during a chaotic firefight.
Runs for his life and relies on cover, but momentarily empties his weapon and must discard it, showing a limitation in sustained fire capability.
Receives help from Connor in a moment of vulnerability, trusts him to lead through secret passages.
Prepares for a last stand weaponless, showing calm acceptance without panic or anger.
Remains calm and ready to face inevitable confrontation weaponless, showing mental preparedness despite being cornered.
Uses a secret passage hidden in the wall to evade capture, demonstrating knowledge of the White House layout and tactical thinking.
Navigates carefully through the complex and narrow hidden corridors of the White House, demonstrating awareness of the building's intricate structure and its history.
Relies on an 8-year-old boy for guidance through the labyrinthine interior, implicitly acknowledging his own limitations in knowledge of the hidden corridors.
Acknowledges Connor’s help by saying, 'You really saved my hide back there, partner.'
Hesitates and admits uncertainty about Connor’s dad's condition, showing honesty.
Avoids saying goodbye to Connor, saying 'I didn’t think you’d want me to.'
Chokes up when seeing Connor wear the Secret Service cap, revealing emotional vulnerability and sincerity.
Stares numb, awed by the simple pure forgiveness of a child.
Frowns, thinking deeply about the situation and expresses concern about the enemy’s unexpected timeline.
Acknowledges Connor's forgiveness with a hesitant, reflective response, showing emotional awareness but some hesitation.
Frowns and thoughtfully questions the enemy's strategic choice to allow twelve hours, showing analytical thinking and doubt.
Prevents gun from firing by jamming thumb in trigger guard despite severe pain, then kills the attacker to protect Connor.
Realizes the attackers have everything needed to access Cerberus except one element; processes information quickly.
Engages in close combat with a commando who attacks him from behind; successfully disarms and kills the attacker despite injury.
Orders Connor to look away during a violent confrontation, showing awareness of others' emotional states while handling a high-pressure situation.
Lifts Connor into a crawl space to protect him and gives a reassuring look despite the boy's fear.
Quickly climbs an interior wall ladder upon hearing hydraulic sounds above, showing alertness and agility.
Finds and opens an ancient, rusty access door despite difficulty, showing persistence and resourcefulness.
Lifts Connor into a crawl space and instructs him to stay put, demonstrating situational awareness and care.
Stops to search and assess the environment rather than rushing, indicating careful judgment under pressure.
Gives the boy a reassuring look after telling him to stay put, showing concern for his safety.
Displays ruthless efficiency and lethal force in combat without hesitation or apparent empathy.

Silently moves forward with Glock raised, immediately reacts to commando's attack by shattering forearm, quickly subdues and kills first commando, disables second commando’s knee, uses body as shield against third commando, fights skillfully to disarm and grapple third commando.
Bites down on commando's knuckles, breaks free, flips him over, and then kills commando to save himself.
Desperately wills the lift to go faster to escape danger, showing determination and urgency to survive and continue the mission.
Leaps onto the roof and guns down an onrushing commando, taking decisive violent action against enemies threatening others.
Leaps onto the roof to engage enemy, saving fellow agent O’Neil from falling to his death by risking own life.
Considers grabbing his weapon but prioritizes holding onto O’Neil despite lethal threat from Cho.
Leaps onto the roof, grabs a discarded weapon, and immediately uses it effectively to kill an onrushing commando.
Riddles another commando and vaults over the body before it hits the ground, exhibiting physical agility and combat skill.
Sprints forward, discards weapon, and lunges to save a fellow agent dangling forty feet in the air, demonstrating quick decision-making and bravery under pressure.
Faces a deadly threat from Cho while holding O’Neil; despite being forced to choose between his weapon and saving his partner, he maintains presence of mind.
Cho is suddenly shot and killed from an unseen source while Banning is vulnerable; Banning is spared but this is not due to his own direct action or control.
Strains to hold dead or dying comrade O’Neil’s weight and tries to help him, showing concern and care.
Stares helplessly as Connor is taken away, showing emotional vulnerability and concern for others.
Strains to hold O’Neil’s dead weight and hauls him up onto the White House roof despite his own weakened state.
Attempts to call out to and warn Connor in smoky, hazardous conditions though appears unable to prevent Connor from being captured.
Lies unseen and weak on the parapet, unable to stop the enemy from taking the boy.
Clutches Connor’s Secret Service cap as a beacon of hope and straightens up despite being bloodied and battered.
Reaches out to contact others via radio after surviving and sustaining injuries.
Despite being bloodied, battered, and bruised, Banning remains conscious and focused, notices a meaningful clue (Connor’s ball cap), and attempts to make contact over the radio.
Strides across the roof with a face of resolve, prepares to perform his duty after a deadly attack.
Grabs a weapon, checks the magazine quickly and efficiently.
Strides across the roof with a mask of resolve, calmly stating 'My job.' in the face of dead comrades and chaos.
Leaves weapon and tac-com behind, moves into view unarmed with hands held high, showing willingness to surrender to protect others or to de-escalate situation.
Stays hidden in hallway, hesitating to reveal himself despite danger, indicating cautiousness but also prioritizing mission or safety over friendliness.
Remains hidden and silent despite being threatened and under pressure.
Makes the difficult decision to surrender himself unarmed, leaving behind weapons and equipment.
Successfully uses the White House emergency elevator to evade immediate danger.
Does not resist or attempt to fight back when confronted by commandos waiting outside the elevator.
Stands defiant and does not show fear when confronted by hostile forces, looking directly into the camera.
Responds with a question to unknown ally (Sandman), indicating openness and cooperation.
Calmly reassures partner Connor with 'It's okay, partner' under extreme stress.
Makes eye contact and silently communicates with President Asher during a tense standoff.
Confronts Sandman verbally, demanding he take his weapon off the President, defending the President's safety.
Steps into a dangerous smoky bunker confidently, covering his team and maintaining vigilance.
Immediately reacts to Sandman's betrayal with assertive verbal commands to regain control.
Contemplates the implications of Sandman's unwillingness to lower weapon on the President, showing situational awareness.
Simultaneously knocks Sandman’s barrel upward to protect Asher’s head while under heavy gunfire, showing protective instinct.
Cuts one of the commandos in half during a gunfight to neutralize threats, focusing on mission rather than cruelty.
Lunges for the President to protect him despite being cut off and under heavy fire, demonstrating loyalty and commitment.
Moves silently and watches the commandos and hostages carefully, searching for Asher and Connor without interfering.
Moves silently and watches the situation closely, maintaining stealth and situational awareness as commandos and hostages move through the hallway.
Glances behind him confirming Pak is nowhere in sight, indicating vigilance and awareness of surroundings.
Pulls back and remains unseen while observing a potential rally point, showing tactical restraint and intelligence.
Watches Marine One landing and the hostage situation attentively through a small window, assessing the unfolding scenario carefully.
Does not immediately intervene or reveal himself despite knowing danger, possibly due to tactical considerations.
Fires on enemy commandos to protect hostages, showing decisive action to defend others.
Frantically scans for the President and Connor among fleeing hostages, indicating concern and protective instinct.
Stares in horror at the destruction of Marine One, expressing emotional response to loss.
Smashes window pane and fires a long burst to distract and expose enemy commandos, enabling snipers to take out threats and allow hostages to escape.
Frantically scans for the President after hostages flee and Marine One takes off, showing presence of mind under pressure but uncertainty about the President's whereabouts.
Reacts with horror to the explosion of Marine One, a situation beyond his control but reflecting emotional impact rather than failure.
Races up corridor to retrieve tac-com and weapon left behind, acts quickly to communicate new information about the President and Connor possibly being alive.
Races up the White House corridor promptly, retrieves vital equipment (tac-com and weapon) efficiently, and quickly communicates critical intelligence to Director Jacobs.
Assumes quickly that the President and Connor were not on Marine One despite the wreckage and broadcasts this information, showing keen observation and readiness to challenge prevailing assumptions.
Realizes the urgency of the situation and immediately sprints to the emergency elevator to stop the ICBM detonation.
Struggles to pry open heavy emergency elevator doors but persists until they slowly open.
Quickly rigs a crude harness from elevator cables and prepares to descend a long elevator shaft despite the obvious danger.
After being driven back by automatic gunfire, he immediately returns fire with his MP-5 in an attempt to suppress the enemy.
Defends himself fiercely against Pak despite being out of ammo and trapped, shows determination and courage.
Rescues the remaining personnel by opening the heavy door against all hope.
Frantically tries to stop the crisis by racing to the control console and following instructions to abort the sequence.
Sweat runs into Banning’s eyes but he blinks it away and remains focused on deactivating Cerberus under pressure.
Without hesitation, races across the bunker and vaults down stairs to pursue and assist the President's escape.
Leaps onto the rear of the SLED to follow the President’s escape car, risking his own safety.
Remains completely focused under intense pressure, waiting for and assisting with the deactivation code input with urgency and precision.
Immediately races and vaults down stairs without hesitation after Cerberus is deactivated, decisively pursuing his objective.
Leaps onto the rear of a rapidly accelerating escape vehicle, demonstrating physical agility and quick decision-making.
Ducks into the slipstream to maintain hold on the fast-moving sled car, showing situational awareness and strength.
Suddenly dives from the shadows to tackle Kang, saving the President.
Suddenly dives from the shadows and tackles Kang to the ground, disarming him temporarily.
Holds on to the SLED underwater despite burning lungs and ultimately lets go to conserve himself.
Engages in close combat with Kang, taking a cut from a razor-sharp tanto.
Yells to Asher to run and take Connor, urging them to escape first despite danger.
Uses last of his strength to push opponent into steam vent to save himself.
Immediately re-joins and leads the President and Connor to safety after escaping.
Yells orders to Asher to run and take Connor, showing situational control and prioritization of others' safety.
Grabs Kang's knife hand and engages in close combat, demonstrating physical skills and quick reflexes.
Despite being injured and losing position, pushes Kang's face into the scalding steam vent, using environment tactically to gain advantage.
Leaps up and races for the substation ladder under gunfire, showing determination and tactical awareness.
Prods the President and Connor forward, urging them to move quickly, displaying leadership under pressure.
Dives in front of Asher to take a bullet, saving the President’s life.
Shares a long look with Asher, eyes filled with sweet redemption.
Dives in front of Asher to take a bullet, saving the President’s life and giving Asher a crucial second to act.
Pauses momentarily to assess the situation, glancing between Asher and Kang before choosing to intervene.
Referenced as 'your best man' by President Asher, implying top-tier skill and trust during a crisis.
Stands confidently behind the President during a national address, symbolizing steadfast protection and reliability.
